This is part 1 of the hybrid/dual class character classes.  This week 
we will discuss one way they *might* be.

1st off, all hybrid characters (in this category) belong to a special 
order (orders being living, weapons, treasures, etc) because there 
will be lots of them (see point below for approximate number of 
hybrids using only existing characters).  To make a hybrid, both 
hired characters must be at least experience level *15* and it will 
cost between 1 million and 2 million points, depending on the 
abilities of the new hybird. (Some around 2 million points would be 
the combination of archmage and cleric if you kept certain abilities) 
 Not just any two character classes can merge to become a hybrid - A 
character class and its promoted character class can't; slime and 
archmage can't because of concerns over potential chain-lightning 
problems, and no hybrids with Golems, Giant Skeletons or Towers.

Here's a rough list of how many hybrids there would be with the 
*existing* characters:

1)slime (counting every class but archmage) - 14 hybrids
2)soldier - 14 hybrids (not counting slime)
3)elf - 13 hybrids (not counting classes above)
4)archer - 12 hybrids (not counting classes above)
5)mage - 10 hybrids (not counting classes above or its promoted class)
6)skeleton - 10 hybrids (not counting classes above)
7)cleric - 9 hybrids (not counting classes above)
8)fire elemental - 8 hybrids (not counting classes above)
9)faerie - 7 hybrids (not counting classes above)
10)thief - 6 hybrids (not counting classes above)
11)ghost - 5 hybrids (not counting classes above)
12)druid - 4 hybrids (not counting classes above)
13)orc - 2 hybrids (not counting classes above or its promoted class)
14)orc captain - 2 hybrids (not counting classes above)
15)barbarian - 1 hybrid (not counting classes above)

That makes a running total of *117* possible hybrids using only 
*existing* character classes.  Is there any question why I would 
request a brand new order just to handle hybrids?

Oh yea, how would attacks be decided?  Simple, each characters get to 
contribute 2 attacks to the new hybrid.

how would stats be handled?  Take the sum of each individual from the 
characters and multiply it by 3/4 and that becomes the new stat.
